document_title: Helicobacter pylori infection: Signs and treatment
subsection_name: nhiem-khuan-hp.json_7_Frequently asked questions about H.p. infection?
subsection_content:
1. Is stomach H.p. infection dangerous?
Stomach H. p infection is not a very dangerous condition. In fact, most people infected with Helicobacter pylori have no symptoms and do not develop any health problems. However, H.p. infection is still one of the most common causes of peptic ulcers and a major risk factor for stomach cancer.
2. Can Hp infection be cured?
Hp infection can be completely cured with a suitable treatment regimen. It is important that patients take medication on time and in the correct dose according to the doctor's instructions, combined with lifestyle changes to completely eliminate bacteria and avoid recurrence.
3. What should you eat and avoid when infected with H.p.?
During H.p treatment, patients need to pay special attention to their diet. In addition to ensuring food hygiene and safety factors, patients should supplement foods that are good for the digestive system and have the ability to fight bacteria such as:
Vegetables and fruits: Cabbage, broccoli, cauliflower, radishes, carrots, bell peppers, kale, spinach, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, cherries...; Foods containing probiotics: Yogurt, kimchi, kefir...; Some other foods: Honey, garlic, licorice, turmeric, olive oil...
Besides, patients also need to limit harmful foods that aggravate stomach ulcer symptoms such as:
Hot and spicy food; Fried and greasy foods; Foods containing a lot of acid: Lemon, orange, tangerine...; Alcohol, coffee, carbonated drinks, chocolate, stimulants.
